meanings.definition: Exhausted or worn out from exertion or fatigue.
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, Sarah felt forworn and needed to rest.
meanings.sent2: The forworn athlete collapsed at the finish line after running the marathon.
meanings.sent3: The forworn puppy fell asleep in the sun after playing all day.
meanings.sent4: Her forworn body felt like it had been through a battle.
meanings.sent5: The forworn look in his eyes revealed the tough day he had.

meanings.definition: Preceded by wear or use; showing signs of weariness or fatigue.
meanings.sent1: The forworn shoes had holes in the soles from constant walking.
meanings.sent2: The forworn book had pages that were falling out from being read so many times.
meanings.sent3: The forworn car sputtered and coughed as it struggled up the hill.
meanings.sent4: Her forworn expression showed the stress she had been under.
meanings.sent5: The forworn path through the forest was marked by years of footprints.
